author: colizz
body:
#### PR description:

Enable concurrent GEN configurations in the cfi/cff file in `Configuration/Generator/python`. 
These concurrent GEN utilities improve the multithreading performance, and help to solve issue (for GEN modules): https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/25090#issuecomment-877237758.

As previously discussed with GEN and PdmV, the change is base on four rules documented in https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/CMSPublic/WorkBookGenMultithread#TL_DR, with details as follows.

Search over all fragments in `Configuration/Generator/python` ..
  1. for *all* the case matches twiki rule#1 (ExtenalLHEProducer), directly modify the fragment. Note that a subset of these fragments used for ReVal (relval_generator + relval_extendedgen) workflows is already modified in a previous PR https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/33516
  2. for *all* the case matches twiki rule#2 (PythiaHadronizerFilter), directly modify the fragment. Note that all fragments satisfying this rule are already modified in PR https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/pull/29305
  3. for *all* the case matches twiki rule#3 (PythiaGeneratorFilter), directly modify the fragment.
  4. pick eight existing workflows running different types of GeneratorFilter (they matches twiki rule#4), to enable the use of ExternalGeneratorFilter. Eight new RelVal IDs are created for them and placed into `relval_extendedgen.py`.

A summary of all changed cfi/cff files are shown in the below table.

Additional change: modify the number of events to 12 for workflow 537 to fix the issue in 4-thread concurrent mode. See https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/issues/34531

A backport to 10_6_X is also needed.

#### PR validation:

Validated on all modified/added RelVal workflows. Here is a summary
